Amount received by the daughter on the first day;\(a= _{k}_\)
increment in the amount received by the daughter;\(d=_{k}_\)
Let the cost of the scooty be X
Amount of money collected by his daughter is;\(S_n=2X\) in \(n=_{l}_\) days
using the formula \(S_n=\frac n2[2a+(n-1)d]\)
Here a=d,
So \(S_n=\frac n2[(n+1)d]\)
2X=_{{(Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*(k)+(l-1)*(k))}}_
Cost of the scooty is X=_{{((Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*(k)+(l-1)*(k)))/2}}_
let the days taken to collect X amount be t
\(S_t=\frac t2[(t+1)d]\)
we know a=d, in this case
the quadratic in t becomes; \(t^2*d+t*d-2X=0\)
\(t=0.5*(\sqrt{_{{(((Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*(k)+(l-1)*(k)))/k)*4}}_}-1)\)
\(t=_{{trunc(Decimal('0.5')*(sqrt((((Decimal('0.5')*l)*(2*(k)+(l-1)*(k)))/k)*4)-1),2)}}_\)

content.text:
A shopkeeper keeps some amount of his daily earning and gives the rest to his daughter to collect to buy a scooty.
The daughter observes that each day she is getting Rs _{k}_ more than the previous day.
The earnings of the shopkeeper increased at a constant rate
After _{l}_ days the daughter observes that she has collected twice the money required to purchase the scooty.
Find the minimum days after which the girl could have purchased the scooty.
